title: CatalystSchool - Eastern Hemisphere
description: 東半球のコミュニティの新しいメンバーをCatalystに参加させるには？

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great, low cost proposal by a committed team associated with the catalyst school and eastern town hall to build up a new leaders and to service members in their  in the Eastern Town Hall. This will lead to further fund proposals to continue to grow committed Catalyst and Cardano community members across many languages in the Eastern Time Zone.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are committed experienced catalyst members who have a clear plan and are fully capable of delivering. The Eastern town hall is a great way wo reach the large population in that time zone which covers many non-English languages.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a simple small proposal which will be easy to audit and gauge success. By splitting this into a small proposal now, voters can take one small step, and when proven successful move on to fund the the next step.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal will be really helpful for new proposer or community advisor that would like to learn more about Project Catalyst but with their own native language. The Catalyst School will likely to provide support in several languages for these new proposer or new community advisor.
f6_assessments.q1: I've participated their workshop in Easter Hemisphere Town Hall and it really helps new people to learn more about Project Catalyst. This proposal is a part of their project to gain more audience via providing support/workshop with more languages in Eastern Hemisphere. Budget is reasonable. And the team consist of veteran in Project Catalyst. This project will likely to success.
f6_assessments.q2: KPI is quite clear. Community can join and check the workshop or support via their meeting online. Plus there should be a documented/recorded session in Youtube if I am not wrong. They have Discord channel too, that documented each workshop accordingly. So it's quite easy to track the progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal shows mature approach, by building step by step and having the project split into smaller parts. As it is described it addresses the challenge by attracting non English community members and in the same time educating people.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the information given, there is already some experience available and since it is building onto the earlier steps it has a good chance that the proposal will be implemented properly.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones are clearly explained as well the proposer was providing metrics information also. Training sessions and work packages stated and can be tracked.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem of how to add new eastern hemisphere members to the catalyst has been identified. The proposer presented as a solution a partnership to provide classes in eastern languages. The proposer presented metrics to monitor the project's evolution and its impact on the community. A financial plan for the future has not been presented therefore It is not possible to assess the financial sustainability of the project in the future. I think it would be interesting to explain in the proposal what the Catalyst School and the Estern Town Hall are, in order to facilitate the understanding of the proposal for those who do not know these two projects in advance.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is aligned with the challenge. A roadmap and key metrics were presented that allow evaluation and monitoring of the proposal's success. Experiences relevant to project implementation were referenced. The budget was very detailed and appears to be reasonable for the proposed work. A realistic deadline for completion of the work has been set.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap and milestones were presented. In addition, they also presented key metrics to enable auditalibity. Therefore, enough information was provided to keep track of the project's success

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal takes a very creative approach of using English-language training of bilingual trainers to increase outreach in the Eastern community and in Eastern languages. It is highly aligned to the goal of the challenge of delivering multilingual resources, and takes a creative approach to delivering meaningful results in a moderate budget. There is also a very strong linkage to the team's main proposal to build Catalyst School.
f6_assessments.q1: The team clearly has the skills to deliver this proposal, and the plan is clear and detailed. The fact that this team has already delivered the early stages Catalyst School is strong evidence that they can deliver what is proposed here.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes precise metrics of what will be delivered (choosing teachers, training them, and delivering 12 Catalyst School sessions and 15 support sessions) and how funds will be spent to achieve it. I strongly agree that this information is sufficient for auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: A proven (and previously funded) proposer, partnering with another developed group to provide training sessions in several additional languages, definitely effectively addresses the challenge of multilingual resources. With "Eastern" languages being focussed on, this is going to have an important regional impact. The blueprint of which, can then be used to develop even more languages. This is definitely a good use of funds.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer here is a proven entity and has successfully delivered training resources in English thus far, so one should be able to have faith that they will be able to replicate this success with the partnership of the right people. My only concern is that the budget is somewhat under-estimated. There is a cost breakdown on what appears to be the training sessions themselves but nothing accounted for pre & post event administration. Assuming this is not free time, it would be good to see this added to the budget. As a professional who has run online events for the last 10+ years in the corporate world, I can safely say that effective preparation and post-event follow-up is essential to entrench 1. the attendee rates and 2. the stickiness of the learning. All of that takes a considerable amount of time - in fact, oftentimes more time than the event itself.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the proposer has done a good job of outlining what they hoping to achieve and what their KPIs might be, but it would be good to see some SMART targets, including but not limited to, actual school session numbers. Additionally, there is little mention of risks or potential challenges - any online event is going to have numerous risks associated (for example, presenter issues, low attendee numbers, technical issues on the day etc etc). While I wouldn't expect to see an exhaustive list, it would be good to get a sense that the proposer has thought through/had experience of such potential issues and has a plan in place to address these as and when they arrive. This will give voters more confidence in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal address the challenge very well. Duplicating a model that is working in English to other Languages makes a lot of sense. As a person that worked and lived in many countries including developing countries such as Indonesia, I can appreciate the importance of language and localization to improve reach, engagement, and results. 
The approach of the proposal is also very good guiding relevant members on how to become teachers for their local language and even teach/support them to make a proposal for fund 7. It gives a good example of how to grow a healthy community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The partnerships between the Cardano School and the ETH make a lot of sense instead of each party trying to do it separately. I actually participate in the ETH and was present when the Cardano School did the CA session, so initial collaboration already working great. 

The teams have a lot of experience with Catalyst and are already very active members positively impacting the community. The ETH team already has some key team members from local countries in the region. So definitely, the team will be able to complete the tasks in the proposal. 

A couple of remarks: 
It could have been helpful to details the ETH team (like the Cardano School did)  or at least the ones that will be involved. If you already have in mind the 3 selected members it will be helpful to have their names and background and why you selected them.

I would also recommend having a selected team lead from each team so coordination is clear and simple. Finally, I did not understand why in ETH team in the mission part, West Africa is being referred.    

The budget seems reasonable and detailed. It could have been good if you mentioned when the budget goes to the school or to ETH, for example, the project management part. The payments will be done to ETH and the School to specific team members doing the work? I assume it is the latter and in this case, I would have it next to the budget item for full clarity.
f6_assessments.q2:
Regarding the roadmap and milestones, they are laid out in a simple way but there are few things that need to be more precise. Does the budget request refer only to the first 3 months after being funded? Why it is written "end of fund 7"? Once, I understand what you meant it is then easy to follow up on and audit. 

The KPIs are in line with the challenge objectives. One thing that would have been helpful is to have some tangible numbers in the KPIs for how many attendees and how many proposals submitted your forecast.  Sharing some reference numbers from the school's current activities would have been helpful. 

Finally, any risks and challenges? For example, how do you choose the candidate to be a teacher? What will happen if there are many candidates?

solution: カタリスト・スクールとイースタン・タウン・ホール（ETH）のパートナーシップ：ETHの期間中、カタリスト・スクールのセッションをイースタンの言語で提供する。
experience: ベテランのアドバイザーや提案のメンター、教育の専門家、Funds初期からの非常に活発なCatalystコミュニティのメンバーなどです。
